newsitem.title: POLAND: BIG, FUND UNDERWRITE VISCOPLAST ISSUE.
newsitem.headline: BIG, FUND UNDERWRITE VISCOPLAST ISSUE.

text.p: A consortium of bank BIG SA and one of National Investment Funds underwrote a 900,000-share issue of the Polish chemical company Viscoplast SA, which seeks a parallel market listing, Viscoplast said on Wednesday.

It said in a statement that under a recent agreement BIG underwrote 605,000 shares while the National Investment Fund No. 11, one of 15 such institutions created under Poland's mass privatisation scheme, underwrote 295,000 shares.
Their stand-by fee is 3.3 percent of the value of the shares, it said.
Viscoplast offers its share at between 12 and 16 zlotys a piece.
Its 690,000-share large-investor tranche will be issued from January 27 to February 5, with a maximum share amount for which investors may register at 65,000 shares.
Small investors will register for a total of 210,000 shares from January 27 to January 31.
Viscoplast netted 3.6 million zlotys in 1995 on sales of 36 million zlotys. It estimates its 1996 net profit down to 1.8 million and to 2.8 million this year.
